alert.note: Alert for Poinsett (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 29 at 5:37PM CST until January 30 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... A Levee Failure on the Cache River in... Northwestern Poinsett County in eastern Arkansas... * Until 900 AM CST Tuesday. * At 537 PM CST, the Poinsett County EMA reported a levee on the Cache River near Pitts, AR had been breached causing flooding of the immediate surrounding areas. The breach has grown to 50 yards and it expected to increase to over 300 yards. Sandbagging is ongoing in the area. HAZARD...Flash flooding from a levee failure. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flooding of areas near the levee break. * Locations affected include Pitts, Arkansas This includes the following streams and drainages... Flag Slough Ditch, Willow Ditch and Cache River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED LEVEE FAILURE...OCCURRING
info.instruction: If you are in low lying areas along the you should move to higher ground immediately. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
